question: Q.1: Within Java, you need to code your program so that under certain conditions it will skip the current iteration of a for loop. What can be used to accomplish this?
Q.2: Which company now owns Java?
Q.3: Within Java, each call to StdOut.println () does which of the following?
options: Appends text to the end of the file
Prints the contents of the current file
Reads and then prints the contents of the current file
Overwrites the current contents of the file
answer: Appends text to the end of the file

question: At this point in time, which of the following is the officially supported version of Java?
Q.5: Which of the following individuals is credited for first designing Java?
Q.6: Which keyword keeps the main method from returning any value to the caller?
Q.7: You need to reference a value stored in an array named B in row 7 column 3. Which syntax is correct within Java for finding the value of this variable?
Q.8: According to Boolean operations, if !g is true, then which of the following applies?
options: If g is true, and true otherwise
If g is false, and true otherwise
If g is true, and false otherwise
If g is false, and false otherwise
answer: If g is true, and false otherwise

question: Q.9: You are having a problem with the “if” logic in your code and need to utilize case conditions to create a number of possible execution paths. Which statement is necessary to accomplish this?
Q.10: Which keyword keeps the main method from returning any value to the caller?
